definition: at top speed/at a tremendous lick
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: He was rushed to hospital last week after suffering a collapsed lung.
sentences.chinese: 上星期，他因出現肺萎陷而被火速送進醫院。

sentences.english: China's railway minister, Sheng Guangzu, was reported to have rushed to the scene.
sentences.chinese: 據報道，中國鐵道部部長盛光祖已經火速趕往現場。

sentences.english: I rushed to the squadron fire officers and soldiers rushed to the scene and started a fire fight.
sentences.chinese: 我中隊消防官兵火速趕往現場並展開了火災撲救。

sentences.english: Stings the target, reducing Strength and Agility by -20 for 20 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 刺擊目標，在20秒內降低目標20點氣力和火速。

sentences.english: Medical aid must be sent to the stricken area posthaste.
sentences.chinese: 醫療援助必須火速送到災區。

sentences.english: He called an ambulance and was rushed to the hospital, where the doctors informed him that he had undergone massive surgery.
sentences.chinese: 於是他叫來了救護車，並被火速送往醫院。

sentences.english: She went post-haste to the bank and cashed the cheque.
sentences.chinese: 她火速趕到銀行，把支票兌換成現金。

sentences.english: The wounded were rushed to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 受傷的人被火速送到醫院。

sentences.english: Be swift to Listen, slow to talk.
Herold pleads with the dispatcher for police to "please hurry" to save her friend from the beating.
sentences.chinese: 特羅德懇求調度員讓警察們“火速”來救她的朋友。

sentences.english: Sun Sikang actually want to drink a cup of coffee, Cao Zheng rushed to buy.
sentences.chinese: 孫四康心心念念想要再喝一杯咖啡，曹政火速去買。

sentences.english: The general hastened to the relief of the fortress.
sentences.chinese: 將軍火速前往救援該要塞。

sentences.english: Rushed home again with his family rushed to the Suizhou.
sentences.chinese: 火速趕往家中，又一次與家人一起趕往隨州。

definition: that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
in the first moments (of sth happening)/immediately (after an event)/first thing
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
